content:
Energizer is a well-known and trusted brand, and their Size 13 Hearing Aid Batteries are a popular choice among hearing aid users.

To estimate how long a pack of 6 batteries will last you, we'll need to consider a few factors:

1. **Your hearing aid usage**: You mentioned you've been using the same set for months, which suggests you're a moderate to heavy user.
2. **Hearing aid type and power consumption**: Phonak BTE hearing aids are generally considered to be moderate-power devices.
3. **Battery life**: Energizer Size 13 batteries have an average lifespan of 120-150 hours, depending on the hearing aid's power consumption and usage.

Assuming you use your hearing aids for around 12-16 hours a day, a single battery might last around 7-10 days. With a pack of 6 batteries, you can expect the following:

* 6 batteries x 7-10 days per battery = 42-60 days of total usage

Keep in mind that this is a rough estimate, and actual battery life may vary depending on your specific usage patterns and hearing aid settings.

To get a more accurate estimate, you can track your battery usage over the next few weeks. Make a note of the date you replace each battery, and you'll get a better sense of how long they last in your specific situation.

Remember, it's always a good idea to have a spare set of batteries on hand, especially if you rely heavily on your hearing aids. You can consider ordering another pack of 6 batteries in 2-3 months to ensure you don't run out unexpectedly.

I hope this helps! If you have any more questions or concerns, feel free to ask.
